page.title: 04HALL FARM, LUTWYCHE, SHROPS.
page.content: This is an owner/occupier farm and what is termed a family farm,using no outside labour on a regular basis, being self-run by a father and 2 sons aged 21 and 22. It is mainly a dairy farm. The sons maintain and keep the machinery in working order; welding, bricklaying, fencing etc. all being done by themselves. The Young Farmers Club offers a wide scope of interests and pursuits for young people in these rural areas, and one son made a cup- winning trailor this year. Grain is grown but for use only in feeding on the farm - none being sold. Silage is harvested along with a little hay. Being a family enterprise,hardly a mealtime goes by without farm matters being raised - a way of life indeed, and full of interest.
